content: I've added to the Connectathon spreadsheet some details for a Walgreens $bulk-publish endpoint, working with the team there to wrap their existing API. It's not yet compliant, but it's a start (with caveats described in the comments).

I've got an updated version of Walgreens data being published now to https://wbaschedulinglinks.blob.core.windows.net/fhir/$bulk-publish -- a few notes:

  • Added NPI for each location -- these are available for each pharmacy location and presumably are good cross-organizational identifiers. Do others have/use NPIs for locations? (FHIR defines an Identifier System of http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/us-npi for these, which is what I'm using.)
  • Added lat/lon for each location
  • Added county for each location
  • Latency of slot data is now ~0-5 min, rather than the 0-20min I had previously
I was a little unclear from the call last week and didn't have much luck getting in touch with Amy Park about it: is this effectively Walgreens’s official API right now?

We can continue to try to clarify this; I'm still hoping to hear about finer grained access. In the meantime, I think "effectively" this is the official Scheduling Links API, so what you say is correct (though to be clear, Walgreens does have a non-standards-based official API, which is currently the source for what I've published above).
:thumbs_up: Thanks, that helps! I’ll start using this ASAP, and will also make sure to ask about it in the call tomorrow.
